page.title: 16ANNUAL EVENTS ON ALSTON MOOR
page.content:
SHEEPDOG TRIALS The event attracts 60+ competitors from as far as Sheffield and Lockerbie. Members of the committee supply 320 Swaledale and Blackfaced sheep for the trials. There is a total of 16 prizes to be won. It is a two- day event with the local trials on the Friday and the open on the Saturday. The course doesn't change from year to year. It attracts many spectators.
FLOWER SHOW. The show was first held in 1968 and is one of the best in Cumbria. It is held in Samuel King's School on the second Saturday in September. Around 100 people enter in the 124 classes which are judged by qualified judges. Prizes range from 25p to Â£3. It is well attended by locals.
